topic: Trustworthiness Benchmarks for AI Models

  entities:
    HEIM|Benchmark
    HRS-Bench|Benchmark
    Stable Bias|Benchmark
    DALL-EVAL|Benchmark
    GenEVAL|Benchmark
    MultiTrust|Benchmark
    MLLM-Guard|Benchmark
    MM-SafetyBench|Benchmark
    UniCorn|Benchmark
    BenchLMM|Benchmark
    Halle-switch|Benchmark
    Red-Teaming VLM|Benchmark
    JailBreak-V|Benchmark
    GOAT-Bench|Benchmark
    Ch3Ef|Benchmark
    GenderBias|Benchmark
    TrustGen|Benchmark
    Text-to-image models|Model
    Vision-language models|Model
    Large language models|Model

  proposition: Text-to-image models and vision-language models have multiple trustworthiness evaluation benchmarks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|Multiple trustworthiness benchmarks
    Vision-language models|EVALUATED_BY|Multiple trustworthiness benchmarks

  proposition: HEIM benchmark covers truthfulness, safety, fairness, and robustness dimensions.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    HEIM|COVERS|Truthfulness
    HEIM|COVERS|Safety
    HEIM|COVERS|Fairness
    HEIM|COVERS|Robustness

  proposition: HRS-Bench focuses specifically on truthfulness assessment.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    HRS-Bench|FOCUSES_ON|Truthfulness assessment

  proposition: Stable Bias primarily addresses fairness concerns.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Stable Bias|ADDRESSES|Fairness concerns

  proposition: TrustGen is the most extensive benchmark covering truthfulness, safety, fairness, robustness, privacy, machine ethics, and advanced AI risk.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    TrustGen|COVERS|Truthfulness
    TrustGen|COVERS|Safety
    TrustGen|COVERS|Fairness
    TrustGen|COVERS|Robustness
    TrustGen|COVERS|Privacy
    TrustGen|COVERS|Machine ethics
    TrustGen|COVERS|Advanced AI risk

  proposition: TrustGen supports evaluation of multiple generative foundation models including text-to-image models, large language models, and vision-language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|Text-to-image models
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|Large language models
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|Vision-language models

topic: Guidelines for Trustworthy Generative Foundation Models

  entities:
    Generative foundation models|Model
    EU AI Act|Framework

  proposition: Trustworthiness of generative foundation models is a multidimensional characteristic.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative foundation models|CHARACTERIZED_BY|Multidimensional trustworthiness

  proposition: Guidelines differ from existing frameworks like EU AI Act by being application-agnostic and stakeholder-adaptive.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Guidelines|DIFFERS_FROM|EU AI Act

  proposition: The guidelines function as both a "value anchor" and a "value scale" for trustworthy generative foundation models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guidelines|SERVES_AS|Value anchor
    Guidelines|SERVES_AS|Value scale

topic: Ethical Considerations for AI Models

  proposition: Ethics and social responsibility are essential for model behavior.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    AI Models|REQUIRES|Ethics
    AI Models|REQUIRES|Social responsibility

  proposition: Guidelines must respect human rights, cultural diversity, and societal values.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guidelines|RESPECTS|Human rights
    Guidelines|RESPECTS|Cultural diversity
    Guidelines|RESPECTS|Societal values

  proposition: Risk management is crucial for addressing potential threats and model failures.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guidelines|INCLUDES|Risk management
    Guidelines|ADDRESSES|Potential threats
    Guidelines|ADDRESSES|Model failures
